I tried to telephone
 They said you were not home
 That’s a lie
 ’Cause I know where you’ve been
 I saw you walk in your door

John knows where his love interest is because he’s been watching her. In retrospect, that’s not cool, John.

He’s also been calling regularly enough that she’s got her family briefed to answer the phones in case he calls, and tell him that she’s not in so that she doesn’t have to talk to him.

John would even have trouble getting Yoko to answer the phone in 1980 – see “I’m Losing You”:

Somehow the wires have crossed
Communication’s lost
Can’t even get you on the telephone
Just got to shout about it

I nearly died, I nearly died
 ’Cause you walked hand in hand
 With another man in my place

John is really upset because he realises this girl has moved on, but does not have the courtesy to tell him.

Paul would revisit this sort of emotion on “Oh! Darling”:

When you told me you didn’t need me anymore
Well you know I nearly broke down and cried
When you told me you didn’t need me anymore
Well you know I nearly fell down and died

This happened once before
 When I came to your door
 No reply
He’s gone around his girlfriend’s house, and she hasn’t answered the door. It’s safe to say that their relationship is on the rocks.
